item.title: Liverpool stripped of Unesco World Heritage status
item.description: The city is deleted from the much-coveted Unesco list because of developments on the waterfront.

item.title: Brexit: NI-GB trade agreement must be overhauled immediately - UK
item.description: The government says the Northern Ireland Protocol is damaging trade and tearing at the "fabric" of the UK.

item.title: China floods: 12 dead in Zhengzhou train and thousands evacuated in Henan
item.description: Passengers describe how they climbed onto chairs to keep their heads above the floodwaters.

item.title: Medal hope Amber Hill out of Tokyo Olympics
item.description: British medal hope Amber Hill withdraws from the women's skeet competition at this summer's Olympics after testing positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Priti Patel defends deal to stop rising numbers crossing Channel
item.description: The government is paying France £54m in a bid to stem the number of migrants travelling to the UK.

item.title: Dr Michael Heath: Families feared they cremated the wrong person
item.description: Families say Dr Michael Heath made multiple errors investigating the deaths of their loved ones.

item.title: 'Catastrophic' backlog at driving licence body, warns union
item.description: MPs are told bad decisions by DVLA managers resulted in a "catastrophic" processing backlog of 1.4 million cases.

item.title: Seaside poor health overlooked, warns Whitty
item.description: Bad housing and deprivation are a toxic mix for health, says England's chief medical officer.

item.title: Giant hail damages cars and windows in heatwave storm
item.description: Golf ball-sized hail comes "thundering down" as the extreme heat warning for England continues.

item.title: Vue Cinemas apologise over Birmingham seat crush death
item.description: The chain was fined £750,000 after Ateeq Rafiq died after getting trapped at Star City.

item.title: Marcus Rashford mural notes to come down as heavy rain forecast
item.description: The heartfelt messages will be removed for safekeeping amid plans to create a permanent display.

item.title: Dinosaurs: 'Spectacular' fossil footprint find by four-year-old goes on display
item.description: A 200-million-year-old fossilised footprint could help scientists understand how dinosaurs walked.

item.title: Tens of thousands of Jurassic fossils found at secret site
item.description: The fossils were originally uncovered by two hobby palaeontologists during lockdown.

item.title: American football star Tom Brady cracks election results joke at White House
item.description: The star quarterback shared a laugh with President Biden and said people "don't think we won" either.

item.title: Cyber-flashing: 'I get explicit messages every day'
item.description: Influencer Elle Edwards lets us inside her DMs to show the extent of sexual abuse faced by women online.

item.title: Meet Mick, Scarborough's 'fly-tipping hero'
item.description: Mick Couzens is working with different community groups and the council in Scarborough to tackle the problem head on.

item.title: The battle for Indonesia's Gold Island
item.description: There are fears that a mine will threaten Sangihe island's ancient forests and local water supply.

item.title: Ballywatticock's moment in the sun
item.description: On Saturday, Northern Ireland hit record-breaking heights as thermometers soared above 30C.

item.title: Jeff Bezos and crew launch into space on New Shepard
item.description: Billionaire Jeff Bezos has launched into space, in the first crewed flight of his rocket ship, New Shepard.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Athletes find new ways to train in lockdown
item.description: Participants in the upcoming Games have been going to unusual lengths to stay in shape under restrictions.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The referee making Olympic history
item.description: The first Arab and African woman to referee 3x3 basketball at the Olympics shares how her Muslim faith has guided her career.

item.title: Cocaine in the UK: The DJ and friends helping addicts beat their 'beasts'
item.description: More people in the UK are taking cocaine. A DJ and ex-addict in Liverpool is helping them stop.

item.title: Covid: What happens when people no longer have to wear masks?
item.description: Face coverings became optional in many settings in England on Monday - what's the evidence for them?

item.title: Heatwaves: What do they do to the body and who is at risk?
item.description: What impact do high temperatures have on our bodies?

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Eight takeaways from his interview
item.description: The PM's former chief adviser on lockdowns, Downing Street rows, Brexit and coup discussions.

item.title: Is there a solution to the hospitality staff crisis?
item.description: Aside from Covid and Brexit, are there other reasons for the shortage of hospitality workers?

item.title: 'Jurassic Pompeii' yields thousands of 'squiggly wiggly' fossils
item.description: Scientists are excavating one of the most important Jurassic sites ever discovered in the UK.

item.title: Lee Child: Why Forsyth's Day Of The Jackal was a game-changer for thrillers
item.description: The Jack Reacher novelist explains the huge influence of Frederick Forsyth's first thriller.

item.title: Sudan's Darfur conflict's latest surge in violence displaces thousands
item.description: "I have cried so much, my eyes can barely see," one mother tells the BBC after seeing her brother die.

item.title: Covid: The Mexican villages refusing to vaccinate
item.description: Residents in remote Mexican towns are being influenced by lies and rumours swirling around on WhatsApp.

item.title: Migrant crossings: What happens to migrants who reach the UK?
item.description: The government wants to cut the number of migrants crossing the Channel.

item.title: Indian actress stirs debate over women's role at cremations
item.description: Indian actress Mandira Bedi made news for doing her husband's last rites, generally a male preserve.

item.title: Jones to captain Lions in first Test against South Africa
item.description: Alun Wyn Jones returns to captain the British and Irish Lions against South Africa on Saturday, in a side including three Scottish players for the first time since 1997.

item.title: Excitement for Hundred 'through the roof' - Morgan
item.description: The England players are relishing playing against each in The Hundred, says limited-overs captain Eoin Morgan.

item.title: Team GB beat Chile in Olympic football opener
item.description: Team GB started their Olympic campaign successfully as the women's football side comfortably beat Chile in an empty stadium in Sapporo, Japan.

item.title: 'We got bopped' - Sweden end USA's 44-match unbeaten run in Tokyo
item.description: Sweden's women's football team stun world champions the United States in their opening match at the Olympic Games in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ellen White scores brace to secure victory 2-0 for Team GB against Chile - highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as Ellen White strikes twice in Sapporo to give Team GB a 2-0 win over Chile in the opening women's football match of Tokyo 2020.

item.title: NBA Finals: Giannis Antetokounmpo scores 50 as Milwaukee Bucks win first NBA title for 50 years
item.description: Watch as Giannis Antetokounmpo scores 50 points for the Milwaukee Bucks during their 105-98 victory over the Phoenix Suns to claim their first NBA title for 50 years.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Brazil's Marta scores twice against China
item.description: Watch as Brazil's top goalscorer Marta scores twice to help secure a 5-0 victory over China in their opening game at Tokyo 2020 in the Miyagi Stadium.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and will they go ahead despite Covid?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics begin formally on Friday, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England will have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid: What do over-18s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but Boris Johnson has criticised the take-up among young people.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Fully jabbed adults don't have to self-isolate after visiting amber-list countries - except France.

item.title: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid rules from 19 July: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: Rules on self-isolation are being eased in England for children and fully vaccinated adults.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Projected medal table, Team GB medallists and international stars to watch
item.description: Data company Gracenote forecasts the Tokyo 2020 medal table, Team GB medallists and the international stars to watch.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Daley on triumph, trauma and his likely last shot at gold
item.description: The 'baby' of Beijing has become a father, a husband and an LGBTQ+ spokesperson. Tom Daley has perhaps one final shot at Olympic gold.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: What to expect in the women's football tournament
item.description: The Olympic Games are almost here so what can we expect at the women's football tournament?

item.title: What are the new sports at the Tokyo Olympic Games?
item.description: With 34 new events in total added to the Tokyo Olympic programme, BBC Sport takes a look at what's new.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Partner vows to keep searching for missing hiker
item.description: The partner of missing hiker Esther Dingley explains why he won't give up searching for her.

item.title: Under the skin of OnlyFans
item.description: A BBC investigation reveals concerns about how the site, known for porn, is structured and moderated.

item.title: The Broadway dancer whose lockdown business bloomed
item.description: When Covid closed New York theatres, dancer Robbie Fairchild started a business that put down roots.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Unvaccinated patients with many regrets
item.description: The number of Covid patients in Bradford Royal Infirmary is rising sharply - and half are unvaccinated.

item.title: Olympic Games: 'Gang life nearly killed me - sprinting was my way out'
item.description: As Darren Campbell emerged as a talented teenage sprinter, he was leading a double life as a gang member. A twist of fate broke him free.
